metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14232 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Django 1.11.x before 1.11.23, 2.1.x before 2.1.11, and 2.2.x before 2.2.4. If django.utils.text.Truncator's chars() and words() methods were passed the html=True argument, they were extremely slow to evaluate certain inputs due to a catastrophic backtracking vulnerability in a regular expression. The chars() and words() methods are used to implement the truncatechars_html and truncatewords_html template filters, which were thus vulnerable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1:1.11.22-1ubuntu1
python-django-common - 1:1.11.22-1ubuntu1
python3-django - 1:1.11.22-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.11.22-1ubuntu1').
